leader.name: Ottomans
leader.description: Abdulmecid is scholarly and even-tempered. He balances colony development, trade, improvements and military. He is gracious to allies but may underestimate opponents.

leader.name: UnitedStates
leader.description: 16th President of the United States, he favours strong economy over military attacks.

leader.name: Russians
leader.description: Alexander the Liberator likes to attack early and swarm his opponents with infantry and emphasizes large armies at the expense of technological development.

leader.name: Egyptians
leader.description: Khedive of Egypt and Sudan, regarded as the founder of modern Egypt.

leader.name: Tupinamba
leader.description: Cunhambebe will strike your town hard and fast. A raider with little patience for defense, he is a clever opponent eager to raid your towns and gatherers.

leader.name: Indians
leader.description: Bahadur Shah, Emperor of the Mughals, approaches warfare with a creative and enlightened mind. He resists the urge to let his emotions get the best of him, and as such is very patient and pragmatic. Akbar respects his enemies, yet will not let this prevent him from crushing them with a large and highly sophisticated army.

leader.name: Argentineans
leader.description: Great politician and war strategist, Mitre is not worried about the development of his country, but of the Argentine people. While leaving his country vulnerable, his armies will attack quickly.

leader.name: Mexicans
leader.description: President of Mexico, he favours strong economy over military attacks.

leader.name: WallMapu
leader.description: Tribal Chief of the Mapuches.

leader.name: Portuguese
leader.description: Carlos the Diplomat is calculating and far-sighted. He emphasizes diplomacy and economic development but will resort to military dominance if necessary.

leader.name: Romanians
leader.description: Leader of Romania.

leader.name: Haitians
leader.description: The Emperor of Haiti.

leader.name: Bulgarians
leader.description: No background information available.

leader.name: Danish
leader.description: King of Denmark, last absolute monarch of Denmark.

leader.name: Australians
leader.description: Australian Leader.

leader.name: Spanish
leader.description: Queen Isabella II of Spain is supportive bordering on flirtatious with her allies but mocks and chastises her enemies. She makes full use of the versatility of the Spanish army, but never leaves her colonies undefended. She is unlikely to take dangerous risks.

leader.name: Bolivians
leader.description: Populist eleventh President of Bolivia, champion of indigenous and peasants' rights.

leader.name: Canadians
leader.description: Prime-minister of Canada, he favours strong economy over military attacks.

leader.name: Belgians
leader.description: King of the Belgians, founder of the Congo Free State.

leader.name: XPSioux
leader.description: Red Cloud will strike your town hard and fast. A raider with little patience for defense, he is a clever opponent eager to raid your towns and gatherers.

leader.name: Chileans
leader.description: The architect of Chile conservatism.

leader.name: Habsburgs
leader.description: The only female ruler of the Habsburg Dominions: Austria, Hungary, Croatia, Bohemia, Mantua, Milan, Lodomeria, and Galicia.

leader.name: Ethiopians
leader.description: The Emperor of Ethopia.

leader.name: Centralamericans
leader.description: Second President of Central America, and also Head of State of Honduras, El Salvador and Costa Rica at varying points.

leader.name: Japanese
leader.description: Emperor Mutsuhito Meiji lives a life of cutthroat survival, following the motto: "Life means that I can live to see tomorrow." When he speaks, he does so with certainty, as if whatever he says has already come to pass. When he strikes, he does so first swiftly and without a hint of mercy.

leader.name: Koreans
leader.description: Empress Myeongseong is the ill-fated first Empress of the Korean Empire. She is a witty intellectual, known as a fervid opponent to imperialists, and her subjects would gladly protect her with their lives.

leader.name: French
leader.description: Napoleon III will adapt to any necessary strategy, but he prefers to attack with large, fully-upgraded armies, consisting primarily of cavalry.

leader.name: XPIroquois
leader.description: John Norton is a warlike, but also diplomatic, leader. He is patient and will build up his economy before attacking, with a particular focus on Trade Routes and Native Alliances.

leader.name: Swedish
leader.description: The last king of the union between Sweden and Norway, Oscar II presided over an age of industrialization and neutrality.

leader.name: Germans
leader.description: Otto Von Bismarck is proud and confident. He expresses regret when his men die in battle, but does not hesitate to use his entire military might to accomplish even the smallest task. Bismarck will not neglect his economy, but believes in attacking aggressively.

leader.name: Brazilians
leader.description: Emperor Dom Pedro II is an enlightened monarch with excessive power over the Brazilian government. Favors the economy of his nation. Years of peace may have weakened his army, but the upcoming war has woken up the emperor's courage and bravery.

leader.name: Serbians
leader.description: No background information available.

leader.name: Peruvians
leader.description: Ramón Castilla is the Peruvian President.

leader.name: Maori
leader.description: Maori leader.

leader.name: Zulu
leader.description: King of the Zulu.

leader.name: Colombians
leader.description: Bolívar is an impatient leader who will build forces to attack as soon as possible. He will work hard to control nearby Native villages.

leader.name: Paraguayans
leader.description: Francisco Solano López is arrogant, ambitious and insane. He believes that his nation will only grow with a powerful industries. He's not afraid of threatening his enemies. Agressive and expansionist, he'll attack with large armies.

leader.name: Greeks
leader.description: Leader of the Greek independance movement.

leader.name: Tawantinsuyu
leader.description: Incan Leader.

leader.name: Uruguayans
leader.description: He was also the President of Uruguay.

leader.name: Italians
leader.description: First King of Italy.

leader.name: British
leader.description: Queen Victoria can be aloof, aristocratic and formal. She is a dependable if not overly warm ally. She understands the value of a strong economy and a versatile navy.

leader.name: Dutch
leader.description: William III of Orange rules the Netherlands.

leader.name: Chinese
leader.description: Consort, mother, and aunt to successive Qing emperors, she was the real power behind the throne for almost 50 years.
